messageBody:
--- Kevin Bourrillion <kevinb@...> wrote:
> 2) There's a rumor that if you use Java reflection to access the
> method, there's a way to tweak the Java security settings to allow
the
> call. Not sure how exactly to do this though.

The class java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject (java.lang.reflect.Field,
and Method both extend AccessibleObject, and they are what you use in
reflection to get at fields and methods) has a method
setAccessible(boolean). It requires that you jave the ReflectPermission
named "suppressAccessChecks" (which you will by default in most Java
application development environments).

Beware reflection. It is way cool, but most of the time you really
shouldn't go there.

Regards,

Rob
